original_title: Cuba Mia: Portrait of an All-Woman Orchestra
overview: In the spirit of The Buena Vista Social Club, this powerful documentary from filmmaker Cecilia Domeyko introduces the Camerata Romeu, a rare group of female musicians with a woman conductor -- one of the most popular acts in Cuba. As the musicians' story unfolds, the film also presents a cross-section of other Cuban and Latin American artists, resulting in an experience that's as entertaining to listen to as it is to watch.
title: Cuba Mia: Portrait of an All-Woman Orchestra
